body:
Add binary package for hpcviewer and hpctraceviewer for the Rice
hpctoolkit on Linux x86_64, ppc64 and ppc64le.

----------

I may be pushing the boundaries of flake with the long sha256 strings.
But folding them to the next line is ugly.  So, we'll see how the
judge rules.


Also, hpcviewer depends on java, but the tcl module that spack
created for hpcviewer doesn't depend on java.  I was expecting that
`module load hpcviewer` would also load jdk as a dependency, but it
didn't.

The module file sets `PATH` and `CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH` and prints a help
string.  Nothing else, no mention of java.

Did I miss something, or do tcl modules just not support dependencies?
title: hpcviewer: new package
